info.game_comments:
Pranjal Vachaspati game 1.
Bible book-themed categories for all three rounds.

(1, 1).clue: Part of this 1862 French novel tells of how prisoner 24601 became prisoner 9430

(2, 1).clue: In Americana, a dude was an Easterner who went to vacation at one of these places

(4, 1).clue: Between the boroughs of Queens & Manhattan flows this "directional" river

(5, 1).clue: This 2012 movie thriller set during the Iranian revolution was based in part on an article titled "The Great Escape"

(6, 1).clue: Synonyms for huge include elephantine & this extinct elephant-like animal

(1, 2).clue: This 1978 novel character writes "The World According to Bensenhaver" as a way to cope with his son's death

(2, 2).clue: This Aerosmith song implores the unwary to "never judge a book by its cover"

(4, 2).clue: Queens is the site of Citi Field & this predecessor, seen here

(5, 2).clue: Winston Groom's book was the basis of this film about a man running through history, & that's all I have to say about that

(6, 2).clue: The type of headline seen here is called a screamer, a streamer or this other synonym for a flag

(1, 3).clue: The title of this Jon Krakauer book about a fateful Everest ascent sounds like a good way to disapear

(2, 3).clue: This Oscar winner released a 2012 book of meditations entitled "The Dude and the Zen Master"

(3, 3).clue: We certainly appreciate a good scrivener, one of these

(4, 3).clue: Parts of Queens were once marshland, including these "Meadows" that have hosted 2 World's Fairs

(5, 3).clue: A memorable line in this 2013 movie adapted from a nonfiction book: "I'm the captain now"

(6, 3).clue: Synonyms for lingo include argot & this other word that also includes "arg"

(1, 4).clue: This 1886 Stevenson novel concerns a lawyer, Mr. Utterson, & his connection to a reclusive physician

(2, 4).clue: The OED says this "dude" has "fastidiousness in dress", then as a synonym, uses this word that also has 2 "D"s

(3, 4).clue: Q&A is what quiz shows serve up; QA usually stands for this job of making sure the product is up to snuff

(4, 4).clue: Home each year to the Wood Memorial Stakes, this Queens racetrack sounds like an old Roman construct

(5, 4).clue: Adaptation may be a stretch for "You Only Live Twice"; the script by this "Willy Wonka" guy left out a lot of the novel

(6, 4).clue: This 8-letter synonym for a delegate or ambassador comes from the Latin for "to send out"

(1, 5).clue: Stewart O'Nan's "West of Sunset" chronicles the life of this troubled writer in 1937 Hollywood

(2, 5).clue: Though never elected to the office, he earned the nickname "Dude President" after attaining the post in 1881

(3, 5).clue: It's the job title of Chicago City Council's 47th Ward rep

(4, 5).clue: A nature preserve makes up part of this Queens peninsula that juts "Far" into the Atlantic

(5, 5).clue: The full title of a 2009 film was "Precious: Based on the Novel 'Push' by" this author

(6, 5).clue: Why settle for the devil when you can use Satan or the name of this prince of the devils

(1, 1).clue: 3 of the 4 gospels are "synoptic", or similar in presentation; this fourth one is the outlier

(2, 1).clue: This Norman who died in 1087 founded a line of succession to the British throne

(3, 1).clue: Due to a natural disaster in 2005, this U.S. city saw its population drop from 450,000 to about 230,000

(4, 1).clue: Solomon Burke was the "Bishop" of this music style; James Brown was the "Godfather of" it

(5, 1).clue: This then-Florida-based tabloid newspaper first exposed John Edwards' affair with a campaign worker

(2, 2).clue: In 1975, after a lapse of 44 years, he restored the Bourbon monarchy to Spain

(4, 2).clue: The grandfather of 89 kids, Solomon Burke said his favorite Bible verse was "Be fruitful &" this

(5, 2).clue: The Whiskey Ring, an attempt to divert tax dollars, damaged this former Civil War general's time as president

(6, 2).clue: To express harsh disapproval of something

(1, 3).clue: Habakkuk & Nahum are among the books of the "minor" these--hey, not everyone can be an Ezekiel or an Isaiah!

(2, 3).clue: This Jordanian king who died in 1999 was known to his people as Al-Malik Al-Insan or "The Humane King"

(3, 3).clue: "Jamming" & "Three Little Birds" were 2 of the songs on his landmark album "Exodus"

(4, 3).clue: One of Solomon's crossover hits was a cover of this group's "Proud Mary"

(5, 3).clue: Laker Nick Young got in hot water with this rapper/fiancee of his after a leaked conversation became news in 2016

(6, 3).clue: It's part of a whale's tail

(1, 4).clue: If you turn! turn! turn! the pages of the Bible, you'll find this book right after Proverbs

(2, 4).clue: In the 490s B.C. this Persian king tried to invade Greece twice, losing the second time at the battle of Marathon

(3, 4).clue: Millions of Hindus, Muslims & Sikhs migrated across new borders during the partition of British India in this decade

(4, 4).clue: At London's O2 Arena in 2007, this reunited band had a "Whole Lotta Love" for Burke, who played their aftershow party

(5, 4).clue: Public knowledge of this Italian prime minister's "bunga bunga" parties tarnished his reputation

(1, 5).clue: In "Soliloquy of the Spanish Cloister", Robert Browning rhymed this Pauline epistle with "damnations"

(2, 5).clue: Also known as Bluetooth, this Danish king converted to Christianity in 960 & made it the official religion

(3, 5).clue: Members of this faith arriving in Puritan Boston got an un-Friend-ly reception & a Mass. exodus (or worse)

(4, 5).clue: Solomon Burke was part of a supergroup with this "Stand By Me" singer & fellow artist on Atlantic Records in 1968

(5, 5).clue: The Teapot Dome scandal during President Harding's term was about giving unfair access to reserves of this commodity

(6, 5).clue: Thailand island called the "Pearl of the South"

(0, 0).clue: Before he headed up the Supreme Court, he argued only 1 case before it--a 1796 case he ironically argued on states' rights grounds
